item.title: Tokkulscape Construction
item.dc:creator: @aznboi594 aznboi594
item.description:
@aznboi594 wrote:

[code] public void setCoords(int x, int y, int height) {
if (jailed == 1) {
frames.sendMessage(this, “You are jailed and cannot teleport”);
} else {
if (!AtCastleWars()) {
OverTimer = 2;
}
wc.resetWoodcutting();
mi.resetMining();
ResetSkillSuff();
teleportToX = x;
teleportToY = y;
heightLevel = height;
didTeleport = true;

   [/code]

Anyone know how to contact chris?

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkulscape Construction
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“aznboi594, post:22, topic:354981”]Ok scratch what I said.
While I was having dinner I thought maybe it had to do with the code that sends you to the portal after you logout?

EDIT:
OK figured it out but don’t know how to fix it.
For some reason the “setCoords” allows you to go to all coords but if you are not nearby in the 4th height then it kicks you. Test it in the Tokkulscape source. Do ::coords in home and then telly somewhere else and try to tele to the coords u got from ::coords but in 4th height it will end up kicking you. So now I need to somehow fix “setCoords”…[/quote]Post your setCoords method.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“aznboi594, post:20, topic:354981”]Only hope that I have is that “David” or “I vain I” can help me…

I think I found out that it doesn’t allow you to go to 4th height through a command or object.
I think I need to edit the “setCoords” because it doesn’t let use it for the 4th height.[/quote]So you can use the ‘tele’ command to go to height 4?

item.title: Tokkulscape Construction
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:354981”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=451548.msg3318658#msg3318658 date=1282518182]
the playerId * 4 is to give each player their own house, so that it doesn’t interact with the other ones. every 4 height levels, the map repeats itself. so heights 0, 1, 2, 3 are all different, and then when it gets to 4, it repeats. so 0, 1, 2, 3 = 4, 5, 6, 7.

An easy way to test is to comment things out from the bottom up, and when it does something right, make a mark and see what went wrong.
[/quote]I’m pretty sure I already said that :/[/quote]

Indeed you did, I didn’t see your post, lol.

Read full topic

the playerId * 4 is to give each player their own house, so that it doesn’t interact with the other ones. every 4 height levels, the map repeats itself. so heights 0, 1, 2, 3 are all different, and then when it gets to 4, it repeats. so 0, 1, 2, 3 = 4, 5, 6, 7.

An easy way to test is to comment things out from the bottom up, and when it does something right, make a mark and see what went wrong.

item.title: Tokkulscape Construction
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Ok. Then there’s something wrong with your player id.

Change:

[code]case 15482:
p.InHouse = true;
p.OwnHouse = true;
p.HouseHeight = p.playerId*4;
p.frames.showInterface(p, 399);
p.HouseTele = 6;
p.setCoords(3104, 3926, p.HouseHeight);
p.frames.showInterface(p, 399);

break;[/code]
to

[code]case 15482:
p.InHouse = true;
p.OwnHouse = true;
p.HouseHeight = p.playerId*4;
System.out.println("Well, we got here! The playerId is " + p.HouseHeight);
p.frames.showInterface(p, 399);
p.HouseTele = 6;
p.setCoords(3104, 3926, p.HouseHeight);
p.frames.showInterface(p, 399);

break;[/code]

Now compile and use the portal, and tell me what it prints out in the black box when you go in.

Read full topic

David your right. Now what mapdata am I missing?

EDIT:
For some reason I am able to do ::tele 3104 3926 4 and it takes me to the reset map and when I use it with the portal it just kicks me. Strange…
So I do have the map just that I have a glitch somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkulscape Construction
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“aznboi594, post:3, topic:354981”]This is what it looks like in all the 508 sources. Davidscape has the same thing but it work on it. If I put it to 0 it works but everyone goes to the same room. I want it so members have different rooms.[/quote]Haha
But anyway, I think your problem is missing mapdata.

[quote=“I Vain I”]Why is it trying to multiply the player’s height by the players ID?

That’s stupid…

Figure out the height and define it.[/quote]Because every 4 floors the map resets… Try it out. Get on a server, tele to floor 0, then floor 4. The map will be exactly the same, but all NPC’s/Players that were on floor 0 will be gone.

Read full topic
